business.headline: IDFC First Bank shares crash nearly 20% after Rs 590 crore fraudIDFC Bank share price hit a lower circuit shortly after the opening bell, a clear sign of the anxiety that swept through the market. Read on to know more about the fraud disclosure.

UPL share price tumbles 12%: Why is the stock falling today?The stock was down around 12%, sliding toward mid-Rs 600 levels on the Bombay Stock Exchange after the market opened, underscoring fresh concerns on Dalal Street about the path ahead.
Sensex jumps 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 630.25 points to 83,444.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 190.55 points to 25,761.80 as of 9:39 am.

Clean Max Enviro Energy vs Shree Ram Twistex IPO: Where to invest? Check GMPFor investors looking at listing gains, the grey market premium trend offers an early signal. But the two IPOs are very different in size, structure and current sentiment.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market is likely to open higher and rallyGift Nifty futures were trading at 25,744.5 at 7:51 am. This points to the benchmark Nifty50 opening above Friday's close of 25,571.25. The Sensex had also ended last week with modest gains.

India, US reschedule chief negotiators meeting on interim trade deal: ReportThe Indian team was earlier scheduled to start the three-day meeting on February 23 in the US. Joint Secretary in the Commerce Ministry, Darpan Jain, is the chief negotiator of India for this agreement.

JPMorgan concedes it closed Trump's accounts after January 6 attackUntil now, JPMorgan had never admitted that it closed Donald Trump's accounts in writing after January 6. The bank would only speak hypothetically about when the bank closes accounts and its reasons for closing accounts, citing bank privacy laws.

Trump hikes tariffs to 15% after court ruling, says US ripped off for decadesDonald Trump said the 150-day hike is legally permitted and that new "legally permissible" tariffs will be introduced during this period.

Old tax regime gets a boost. Does it work better for you than the new one?Handcrafted ByOur Editors If you have moved on to the new income tax regime, should you give the old one another look after the proposed benefits? Read on to see what the changes could mean for your tax savings.

India is catching up fast with US, China in AI race: IndiaAI CEO Abhishek SinghIn an exclusive interview following the Grand AI India Impact Summit, Abhishek Singh, CEO of India's Mission AI, discusses the nation's emerging role in the global artificial intelligence landscape.

Brazilian President Lula says India and Brazil can trade without relying on US dollarAs Brazil looks to deepen ties with India, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signals a future where the two economies trade more, rely less on the US dollar, and build a partnership driven by growth, technology and trust.

No debates within BRICS to create new currency: Brazil's Lula to India TodayIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva clarified there is no BRICS currency plan, but said India and Brazil can still rethink dollar-based trade and slowly build alternatives.

Can you open multiple PPF accounts? Here's the answerThe Public Provident Fund (PPF) is one of India's most trusted long-term savings options, thanks to its tax benefits, steady returns and government backing. Many investors, however, wonder if it's possible to open more than one PPF account to save more.

SIPs in crypto? What they are and how to get startedCrypto is often linked with sharp price swings and high risk. SIPs, on the other hand, are associated with steady, long-term investing. So what happens when these two very different ideas come together? That is where the conversation around crypto SIPs begins.

Exclusive: AI is like a tsunami hitting jobs market, warns IMF's chiefAccording to Georgieva, AI can boost growth and raise incomes. However, if not handled carefully, it can deepen inequality and unsettle workers.

Sensex ends over 300 points higher, Nifty gains despite market volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 316.57 points to end at 82,814.71, while the Nifty50 gained 116.90 points to settle at 25,571.25. Broader market indices also recovered well through the afternoon, lifting overall sentiment.

Gold jumps nearly Rs 1,000, silver surges Rs 4,000: Time to invest or wait for a dip?After several weeks of uncertainty, gold and silver are now moving higher with steady gains. This has boosted market sentiment, but it has also left many wondering whether to buy now or wait for more favourable prices.

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

8th Pay Commission: When will you get your arrears and salary hike?Central government employees and pensioners are closely watching every update on the 8th Pay Commission. The big questions remain, i.e., when will the new pay structure be implemented, and when will arrears actually reach your bank account?

entertainment.headline: Do Deewane Seher Mein box office Day 3: Mrunal Thakur's film stays ahead of Assi Do Deewane Seher Mein completes its opening weekend with a modest run at the box office, staying slightly ahead of Assi. Here's a look at its day-wise trend, competition from O' Romeo, and what lies ahead for Mrunal Thakur and Siddhant Chaturvedi's romantic drama.

Neither Leonardo DiCaprio nor Timothee, it was Robert Aramayo's night at BAFTA Robert Aramayo stunned Hollywood by winning BAFTA Best Actor for I Swear, beating Leonardo DiCaprio and Timothee Chalamet in a historic upset.

Viral video: Ram Charan hugs Allu Arjun at Allu Sirish's pre-wedding bash Allu Sirish and Nayanika's pre-wedding celebration in Hyderabad, hosted by Allu Arjun and Sneha Reddy, brought together family and friends, including Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela, ahead of the couple's March 6 wedding.

O' Romeo box office Day 10: Shahid Kapoor's film behind TBMAUJ after 2nd weekend Shahid Kapoor's O' Romeo completed 10 days at the box office with a steady second weekend but trails behind his previous hit, Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya. Here's a detailed look at its growth trend, comparison, and how it performed amid new releases.

Assi box office Day 3: Taapsee Pannu's film remains steady over opening weekend Assi collected the same amount on its initial three days at the box office in India. However, it didn't fare as well as Taapsee Pannu and Anubhav Sinha's Thappad during the opening weekend.

Rashmika-Vijay suit up, head to Udaipur with friends, family for grand wedding Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna are set to marry on February 26. The two were seen at the Hyderabad airport with their close friends and family.
Alan Cumming pauses BAFTAs after slur directed at Michael B Jordan Alan Cumming halted the BAFTAs after an unexpected on-air outburst. Here's what unfolded inside London's Royal Festival Hall.

Ghilli, Veeram, Kadhalar Dhinam: Tamil box office banks on reruns amidst crisis Tamil cinema is witnessing a surge in re-runs as new films face delays and low footfalls. Films from 1980s, 1990s and 2000s have been re-released in theatres over the past weeks and more movies are slated for in March.

Hailey Bieber makes $20,000 donation to Eric Dane's grieving family Hailey Bieber has made a significant donation to support Eric Dane's family following his death, and she isn't the only high-profile name stepping forward.

Boong director's BAFTA winning speech is a powerful call for peace in Manipur Boong director Lakshmipriya Devi highlighted the ongoing unrest in Manipur during her BAFTA acceptance speech, using the platform to appeal for peace and hope after her film won Best Children's and Family Film.

BAFTA 2026: Timothee Chalamet and Kylie Jenner serve high-fashion couple goals Timothee Chalamet and Kylie Jenner turned BAFTA 2026 into a high-fashion date night, but the evening didn't unfold exactly as expected.

BAFTA 2026: One Battle After Another crowned Best Film. Check winners' list here Drama One Battle After Another claimed top honours as best film, while Hamnet was named outstanding British film at the annual awards ceremony, with a spread of winners across performance and technical categories.

BAFTA 2026: Alia Bhatt opens speech in Hindi as presenter, greets with Namaskar Actor Alia Bhatt's BAFTA 2026 debut took an unexpected turn when she opened her speech in Hindi. Here's why the moment has everyone talking.

One Battle After Another wins best film, 5 other honours at BAFTA 2026 One Battle After Another, Paul Thomas Anderson's explosive film about a group of revolutionaries in chaotic conflict with the state, won awards for directing, adapted screenplay, cinematography and editing, as well as for Sean Penn's supporting performance as an obsessed military officer.

BAFTA 2026: India's Boong wins Best Children's and Family Film award, makes history Farhan Akhtar-backed Manipuri film Boong has won the BAFTA award for Best Children's and Family Film. The Lakshmipriya Devi directorial is the first Indian film to win in the category.

Alia Bhatt calls Raha her inspiration at BAFTA 2026, Farhan Akhtar joins Boong team Alia Bhatt made her BAFTA 2026 red carpet debut in a silver gown. Boong director Lakshmipriya Devi, producers Ritesh Sidhwani and Farhan Akhtar also graced the event.

Rashmika Mandanna-Vijay Deverakonda make relationship official, announce wedding Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have made their relationship official. The duo shared their wedding plans on social media.

The Kerala Story 2 director slams Anurag Kashyap: He has a problem with everything The Kerala Story 2 director Kamakhya Narayan Singh reacted to Anurag Kashyap's criticism of his film. Anurag had earlier called it a propaganda film.

Amitabh Bachchan regrets missing Sunday meet at Jalsa, shares a note to fans Amitabh Bachchan skipped his Sunday meet with fans outside Jalsa. He expressed regret in a personal note and asked them to save energy for the future.

general news.headline: Videos: Cities burn, airport stormed in Mexico after drug boss El Mencho killedAccording to Mexican security officials, cartel operatives set up more than 250 burning roadblocks across at least 20 states on Sunday, paralysing transport corridors and forcing residents indoors as smoke plumes rose over multiple cities in the aftermath of El Mencho's killing.

'Chanakya' of Bengal politics, Mukul Roy, once Trinamool's No. 2, dies at 71Known as the "Chanakya of Bengal politics," Mukul Roy rose to become the Trinamool Congress's national general secretary after co-founding the party in 1998. He later fell out of favour following his alleged links to the Saradha and Narada scams and was removed from the post in 2015.

From police officer to Mexico's top drug lord: The rise and fall of El MenchoNotorious Mexican drug lord El Mencho, the USD 15-million-bounty cartel boss who built one of the world's most violent criminal empires, has been killed. Here is his criminal legacy.

Indian Air Force grounds Tejas jets after crash earlier this monthUnder investigation, the Tejas fighter jet suffered severe damage during landing after a routine sortie, though the pilot ejected safely. Following the accident, the Indian Air Force has grounded its entire fleet of around 30 single-seat Tejas jets to carry out an intensive technical probe.

How South Africa plotted India's downfall right under their nose in AhmedabadIndia vs South Africa, T20 World Cup: The 100,000 fans in Ahmedabad fell silent again as India were defeated by South Africa in the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup. Ironically, the Proteas planned India's downfall right under their eyes, and the Men in Blue did not even see it coming.

Gujarat to make parent initmation mandatory for marriage, critics cite Hadiya caseIn a move that has sparked a fresh debate over individual liberty versus parental oversight, the Gujarat government has proposed making parental intimation a formal part of the marriage registration process.

Rs 5 crore toll refund for 1 lakh motorists after 33-hour Mumbai-Pune E-way chaosOver one lakh motorists stuck in a massive traffic jam on Mumbai-Pune Expressway due to a gas tanker mishap will receive toll refunds worth Rs 5.16 crore.

How Mexico military took out drug lord El Mencho with US intel's helpMexican security forces killed El Mencho, one of the country's most notorious drug lords, in a US-backed military raid on Sunday. While Mexican forces conducted the raid, the US provided intelligence about El Mencho, a role that resulted in locating him and gunning him down.

We're winning too much: Trump's cryptic post after Mexico drug boss killNemesio Oseguera, or "El Mencho," the mastermind of the powerful Jalisco New Generation Cartel, died in custody after being injured in a military operation by Mexican special forces in Jalisco state.

Gutter, but of gold. Why Dharavi slums charge Rs 5 lakh rent a monthThe towers of Mumbai have seen kilometres of expanse of Dharavi's asbestos and tin roofs for decades. Most pity the slums as a place that is deprived of the basics, while others romanticise them. As Asia's largest shanty town stands at the cusp of a major overhaul, it's humming with enterprise. Beyond the filth, Dharavi runs businesses that generate a billion dollars a year.

Delhi's OG mall Ansal Plaza is now a ghost townHandcrafted ByOur Editors Not every generation might be able to relate to Ansal Plaza or its existence. But that doesn't change the fact that it was Delhi's OG mall. But today, its condition is as good as a ghost town.

Here's a look at how they can still progress to the next round.

Nepal former Hindu king calls for reset as pro-monarchy party takes on a weak OliNepal's election on March 5 comes after Gen Z protests ousted the government of PM KP Sharma Oli in September 2025. Loved by the Gen Zs, rapper-turned-Kathmandu mayor Balen Shah is challenging Oli on his turf in Jhapa. Amid this, Nepal's former king, Gyanendra, has re-entered the equation.

Earth rotates at 1,670 km per hour, so why don't we feel it?We examine why the Earth's constant spin goes completely unnoticed by the people living on it. We think about it and then forget.

Take shelter: India warns citizens after unrest in Mexico over El Mencho's deathThe Indian Embassy in Mexico has advised its nationals to seek shelter, avoid crowds and limit movement after violence flared across several Mexican states following the killing of Mexican drug lord El Mencho in a US-backed military operation.

India served humble pie as South Africa smash the cupcake right back at usA playful dig is one thing. But when the broadcaster mocked South Africa's history of painful exits, they handed the opposition a motivation that no dressing room team talk ever could.

Blackmailed by lover, Surat businessman shoots self days before daughter's weddingBuilder Tushar Ghelani's tragic suicide days before his daughter's wedding has unveiled a hidden relationship and disputed financial dealings. Police arrest Poonam Bhadauria, probing alleged abetment to suicide and property transfers.

Gambhir slammed as India's Washington Sundar experiment fails vs South AfricaIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir faced criticism after Washington Sundar's underwhelming performance against South Africa in the T20 World Cup. The tactical choice to include Sundar over Axar Patel sparked debate over team selection and strategy.

The Indian patent story: Why private universities file more patents than IITs combinedHandcrafted ByOur Editors India has crossed 1 lakh patent filings in 2024–25, with educational institutes driving a 62% surge in a year. Private universities dominate filings, overtaking the IITs. But are these patents signs of real innovation or ranking strategy? This deep dive breaks down patent filings vs patent grants, incentives, reimbursements, and commercial impact to uncover what is really behind India's university patent boom.

sports.headline: T20 World Cup: Cringe cupcake ad taken off after India lose to South Africa T20 World Cup: A pre-match cupcake ad mocking South Africa resurfaced after India's 76-run loss in Ahmedabad. The defeat not only dented pride but also left India's semi-final hopes hanging by Net Run Rate.

Tilak Varma disappointed me: Sunil Gavaskar slams batter's approach in SA loss T20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar questioned Tilak Varma's shot selection after India's heavy Super 8 defeat to South Africa. The former captain felt the chase required patience, not early risk-taking.

Showed that India is beatable: David Miller proud of South Africa's Super 8 win T20 World Cup: David Miller said South Africa proved India are beatable after their 76-run Super 8 win in Ahmedabad. The Proteas veteran credited discipline, experience and sticking to simple plans for the statement victory.

Ironically, the Proteas planned India's downfall right under their eyes, and the Men in Blue did not even see it coming.

India served humble pie as South Africa smash the cupcake right back at us A playful dig is one thing. But when the broadcaster mocked South Africa's history of painful exits, they handed the opposition a motivation that no dressing room team talk ever could.

Sanju Samson back? Coach hints at changes after Abhishek, Tilak flop vs SA India suffered a heavy defeat against South Africa in their T20 World Cup Super 8 fixture. Following their loss, the team is considering recalling Sanju Samson to address persistent opening batting failures.

Gavaskar, Pollock slam India's one-dimensional batting: Threw bat at everything Former cricketers Gavaskar and Pollock criticised India's batting approach after a heavy defeat to South Africa in the T20 World Cup. The loss ended India's 12-match winning streak and raised questions over their adaptability and strategy.

Sunil Gavaskar calls for India's batters to be more than six-hitters after SA defeat Former India cricketer, Sunil Gavaskar, in an exclusive interaction with Nikhil Naz on India Today, opened up on the batting unit of the Indian T20I side after the crushing 76-run defeat to South Africa in the Super 8 stages of the T20 World Cup. The batting legend called for the side led by Suryakumar Yadav to be more than just six-hitters and ones who can also play based on the conditions and the situation as well, when the conditions get tough.

Sundar Pichai says Gavaskar his idol. Batting great lifts lid on T20WC meeting Indian batting great Sunil Gavaskar shared details of his meeting with Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai during the Super Eights clash between India and South Africa in Ahmedabad on Sunday, after the tech leader described him as his childhood idol and recalled growing up with his posters on the wall.

Suryakumar blames poor batting for SA loss, refuses to abandon aggressive style India suffered a heavy defeat against South Africa in the Super 8 fixture of the T20 World Cup 2026. India captain Suryakumar Yadav blamed team's poor batting show for the crushing loss.

T20 World Cup: Why India's semifinal chances look bleak after 76-run defeat to SA South Africa handed India a crushing 76-run defeat at the Narendra Modi Stadium in the T20 World Cup 2026, pushing the Men in Blue into a tricky position with their semi-final spot now under serious threat. Here's a look at how they can still progress to the next round.

Ahmedabad heartbreak 2.0: SA bring India back to earth, hand massive Super 8 lossIndia vs South Africa, T20 World Cup: Ahmedabad continues to haunt India's unbeaten runs. On November 19, 2023, Australia ended their perfect ODI World Cup campaign at the final hurdle. On Sunday, South Africa repeated the script, snapping India's 12-match winning streak in the T20 World Cup, inflicting a crushing 76-run defeat on the hosts.

Gambhir slammed as India's Washington Sundar experiment fails vs South AfricaIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir faced criticism after Washington Sundar's underwhelming performance against South Africa in the T20 World Cup. The tactical choice to include Sundar over Axar Patel sparked debate over team selection and strategy.

Jasprit Bumrah stands out in Ahmedabad: 3 for 15 and a new T20 World Cup recordT20 World Cup 2026, IND vs SA Super 8: Jasprit Bumrah delivered a masterclass in control and craft, claiming three crucial wickets and conceding just 15 runs in his quota of four overs, but South Africa's late surge denied India complete dominance in Ahmedabad.

MS Dhoni unlikely to play all matches of IPL 2026: ReportMS Dhoni has confirmed his availability for the IPL 2026 season with Chennai Super Kings. However, his participation in all matches remains uncertain due to fitness and team strategy considerations.

IND vs SA Super 8: India continue to bench vice-captain Axar PatelIND vs SA, T20 World Cup: India once again left out vice-captain Axar Patel as the defending champions named an unchanged playing XI for their Super 8 clash against South Africa in Ahmedabad on Sunday, February 22.

Sri Lanka hand Harry Brook a birthday gift as England begin Super 8 with winT20 World Cup, SL vs ENG Super 8: Sri Lanka were bundled out for 95 in 16.4 overs as England's spinners ran riot, successfully defending a par total of 146. Will Jacks starred with his part-time off-spin, claiming three crucial wickets in Pallekele on Sunday.

Pakistan Super League: Sialkot Stallionz sold again ahead of new seasonThe Sialkot Stallionz franchise in the Pakistan Super League has been sold again following disputes over ownership and financial background. The controversy raises questions about the PCB's vetting process ahead of the PSL 11 season.

India retain Women's Asia Cup Rising Stars title, beat Bangladesh again in finalIndia A women's cricket team retained their ACC Women's Asia Cup Rising Stars crown after defeating Bangladesh A by 46 runs in the final held at the Terdthai Cricket Ground. The defending champions overcame early setbacks and relied on strong batting and disciplined bowling to secure victory.

IND vs SA Super 8 Highlights: South Africa hammer India by 76 runsIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), T20 World Cup Super 8 Highlights: South Africa hammered India by 76 runs in Match 43 of the T20 World Cup 2026. Chasing a target of 188, India were bundled out for just 111 runs in 18.5 overs.

India loses six on the trot in FIH Pro League, suffers AUS shootout heartbreakIndia's horrible run in the FIH Pro League continued as they lost their sixth match on the trot on Sunday, February 22. Australia edge past the Indian team 5-4 in the penalty shoot-out in Hobart.

Indian-origin players global ambassadors of Indianness at T20 World Cup: PM ModiMany players of Indian origin are making their countries proud, reflecting the true spirit of being Indian, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Sunday. He added that wherever Indians go, they remain connected to their roots while contributing to the growth and development of the country they live and work in.

Abhishek Sharma's 3 ducks a positive: Shastri's stunning claim before IND vs SAT20 World Cup: Ravi Shastri feels that Abhishek Sharma's three ducks in the T20 World Cup 2026 is actually a good thing for India. Shastri feels that the other teams will be scared of the Indian opener knowing that he is due for runs.

Smriti Mandhana writes heartfelt note on Instagram after Australia T20I heroicsSmriti Mandhana posted a cryptic message after her match-winning 82 in the T20I decider against Australia. The India opener stressed that performance, not emotions, ultimately defines success in sport.

Qatar in focus: Doha to host ICC board meetings in MarchDoha will host the next ICC board and committee meetings from March 25 to 27, reflecting Qatar's rapid cricket growth and increasing role in international cricket governance.

After Vini Jr., Fofana, Hannibal receive racial abuse after Chelsea-Burnley drawWesley Fofana and Hannibal Mejbri have been subjected to racial abuse following Chelsea's draw with Burnley in the Premier League. This happens days after Vinicius Jr was allegedly racially abused during the Real Madrid vs Benfica game.

SL vs ENG Super 8 Highlights: Jacks, Archer guide England to 51-run victorySri Lanka (SL) vs England (ENG), T20 World Cup Highlights: England have inflicted a massive 51-run loss on Sri Lanka as Will Jacks, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid and Liam Dawson have run through their batting line up.

India vs South Africa: A cricket journey scripted as Tendulkar's travelogueAs India prepare to face South Africa in the T20 World Cup Super 8 in Ahmedabad, Sachin Tendulkar's career reminds us how one opponent shaped his journey through reunion, rivalry, scandal, accusation, redemption, and ultimate triumph.

Neymar hints at possible retirement at the end of 2026 season: Living year to yearNeymar has revealed he could retire at the end of the 2026 season but remains determined to play one final FIFA World Cup with Brazil. The 34-year-old says he is taking his career year by year.

India's spin power not a threat to South Africa: Neil McKenzie ahead of Super 8 clashT20 World Cup: Neil McKenzie believes India's spin attack will not automatically trouble South Africa in the Super 8 clash. The former Proteas batter feels match-ups and execution will matter more than variety in Ahmedabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
